Class RefCounted

Provides a thread safe reference counting implementation. Inheritors need only implement the Destroy() method, which will be called when the reference count reaches zero. The reference count automatically starts at 1.

Inheritance
System.Object
RefCounted
Storage
Namespace: Arithmetica
Assembly: Arithmetica.dll
Syntax
public abstract class RefCounted : object

RefCounted()

Construct a new reference counted object. The reference count automatically starts at 1.

Declaration

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

AddRef()

Increments the reference count. If the object has previously been destroyed, an exception is thrown.

Declaration
public void AddRef()
| Improve this Doc View Source

Destroy()

This method is called when the reference count reaches zero. It will be called at most once to allow subclasses to release resources.

Declaration
protected abstract void Destroy()

Returns true if the object has already been destroyed; false otherwise.

Type Description
System.Boolean

| Improve this Doc View Source

Release()

Decrements the reference count. If the reference count reaches zero, the object is destroyed. If the object has previously been destroyed, an exception is thrown.

Declaration
public void Release()
| Improve this Doc View Source

ThrowIfDestroyed()

Throws an exception if the object has been destroyed, otherwise does nothing.
